subject: Re: [junit] awkward mocking options.
msgSnippet: ... I haven t done much research into aspects yet, so I don t really know. One thing I dislike about the way aspects are implemented is that the additional
messageBody:
Raja Nagendra Kumar wrote:

> Hi JB!
>
> Not sure if group feels that this is Junit related question.. Please
> excuse if it is not..
>
> Wanted to know how Unit Testing would change with wide adoption of
> aspectJ features, specially w.r.t to mocking some object to test a
> dependent classes. Any papers in this direction is well appreciated.

I haven't done much research into aspects yet, so I don't really know.
One thing I dislike about the way aspects are implemented is that the
additional compilation step (in Eclipse) disrupts my code, save, test
rythym, and that's enough for me not to learn more about it. When the
day comes that weaving aspects is a seamless part of the Eclipse
experience, I'll look into it more.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
